content: your cast on isn t twisted and start knitting you ll be knitting half the stitches for mitt a knitting all the stitches for mitt b and then coming back around to the other half of mitt a to finish the round i like to clip a removable stitch marker to the front of mitt a so i can keep track of where the round starts without risking my stitch marker falling off or getting in the way make sure when you move between mitts to drop one yarn and pick up the next i feel with my hand between each mitt to make sure they re moving independently on the needles and not stuck together once you get the hang of it s quite intuitive to knit two-at-a-time cuff the length of the cuff is completely up to you knit for as long as you would like in 3x1 rib for the purple mitts i knit 2 75 inches before starting the thumb for the black and gray mitts i knit 3 75 inches with some stripes before starting the thumb if you would like to copy my stripe pattern this is what i did ● 2 inches of ribbing with storm ● attach black knit in pattern 2 rounds ● 1 round storm ● 7 rounds black ● 1 round storm ● 2 rounds black ● cut black and continue in pattern with storm till cuff is desired length to save yourself weaving in some ends keep both colors attached the whole time you re making your stripes twist your yarns around each other at the beginning of each round to carry them along up inside the work it s important to keep your ends tidy so your fingers don t snag on any long floats when putting your gloves on and remember each mitt has its own ball of contrast yarn as well thumb once the cuff is how you want it it s time to start the thumb set up round knit 7 sts in pattern from start of round purl 1 pm increase 1 k 3 increase 1 pm purl 1 continue in pattern the increases ride inside of the purl column and the thumb is all knit every increase round increases stitch count between the needles by 2 next round work in 3x1 ribbing to marker knit all stitches between markers continue working around in 3x1 ribbing increase round work in 3x1 ribbing to marker slip marker increase 1 knit to next marker increase 1 slip marker continue working around in 3x1 ribbing continue increasing every other round till 17 21 stitches between markers after the final increase knit around one more time final round of thumb knit 8 stitches in pattern ending with a purl stitch bind off 21 stitches in pattern by knitting and passing the stitch over the next all stitches will be knit except for the very last stitch will be purled and a knit stitch passes over it 17
